Jira sends an email alert with a subject containing "Assigned" in two different situations:

a. When I assign an issue to someone
b. When someone assigns an issue to me

The situation b is much more important to notice, but with the current setup I can't filter the message in my email client.

Maybe every message that is an alert of a change I've done myself should have other kind of a subject line so I could mark them read in my client automatically.

fields.description:
FYI: This issue is related to JRA-968. That issue is marked as non-reproducible but the problem still exists. I have attached the necessary log files that show the errors.

In conjunction with following the instructions for deploying to Tomcat 4.1.x as described by Atlassian do the following.

Steps to reproduce:
  Edit entityengine.xml (see attached file).
  Build 2.5.3 war file.
  Stop tomcat
  Update server.xml (see attached file)
  Add/remove required jars.
  Extract war file contents to directory (i.e., jira253) specified 
   as the docBase in the server.xml file.
  Start Tomcat.

App will come up, you can see data, login, etc. but errors show in catalina.out file consistently. Errors also show in context log file for init() method with root cause being a NullPointerException (see file). 
  
I would be happy to allow a member of the Atlassian team ssh access to  my server if they cannot reproduce the problem there.

Thanks

fields.description:
An issue that was assigned to a user and since then has been reassigned to another user still shows up in the first user's filter Assigned to Me:

The user has not started progress on the issue or anything of that nature.

Looking at the database, in the jiraissue table the assigned user is correct and the front end reflects this.  Also in the changeitem and changegroup tables the changes made to the issue are logged their as well.

I've restarted tomcat thinking it was something accidently stored in memory, however this had no effect.

Any ideas on why this issue is still showing up in the filter results for the user it's not assigned to, or how to correct this?
fields.summary: Issue not assigned to User shows up in Assigned to Me filter

fields.description:
The "Create Issue" step1 shows a drop-down box for "issue type", which requires at least 2 mouse clicks when changing types. Also new users will also unfold the selection list to learn what is possible there.

Since the issue types are of limited amount, a sereis of radio buttons would be more appropiate. This would save at lead one click when entering new issues.

One drawback I see would be that two different controls are displayed in the same view, which could be avoided using a single selection list instead of radio buttons.

Since issue types are configurable, maybe a threshhold is needed to fall back to the current drop-down list. The single selection list form would not need this threshhold.
fields.summary: Change the "issue type" of the "Create Issue" step1 to radio buttons for a 1 click progress.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2961].
  {panel}

The default dashbord portlet displaying mutiple projects is very space consuming and mostly requires scrolling the browser view to be able to select a specific project. The brief version is more usable in this respect, but then the project summary graph is not reachable any more for all projects at one.

It would be an advantage to allow switching between the brief and full
forms via some tab-like controls (like the Filter:View|Edit|New|Manage   selection of the issue navigator) - maybe placed on the bottom of the portlet. The state could be held in a cookie.

Alternately, the "Browse Project" view could allow this brief/full switching.

A more "compact" display form of the full would also be possible. I experimeted with some variations and can send the result as an attachment if desirable.

Thanx,
Christoph
fields.summary: Enhance the displays multiple projects portlet with breif/full tab

fields.description: Whenever a PermissionException occurs (for example, someone trying to access a project for which they don't have the rigts for), a 59 line stack trace is written to JIRA's logs. The stack trace isn't needed and just makes it harder to check for real problems in the logs.
fields.summary: PermissionException excess logging

fields.description:
If a project name or project key are listed in the search box, then we should limit the search to that project.

Eg:

"abc JRA" should search project JRA for "abc"
"abc Jira" should search the Jira project for "abc"
fields.summary: Quick search should also limit projects

fields.description:
When a task is created by using the POP Service (or any service that uses the AbstractMessageHandler.createAttachmentWithPart method) the file size is incorrectly stored in the database.

When the file is later retrieved through the web interface, the download appears to hang.  

I rolled up my sleeves and discovered a few things.  One the size of the file on disk, does not match the size recorded in the database.  This is probably due to line 125 in AbstractMessageHandler.

fields.put("filesize", new Long(part.getSize()));

it's calling getSize on the Mime attachment and not the File that is just returned from the earlier line:

File file = getFileFromPart(part, issue);

A fix should probably read as:

fields.put("filesize", new Long(file.length()));

I hope to see a fix soon, so I can explain to my users that their files are there.

Thanks,
Noah
fields.summary: Attachments are being recorded as the wrong size when handled by the AbstractMessageHandler

fields.description: when compiling JIRA using the war:webapp goal, the activation.jar archive is not included in the resulting webapp.  I believe this is because the war.bundle property is not set for that archive, as it is for e.g. the javamail archive.
fields.summary: activation.jar not included in war builds

fields.description: A number of users have had either the scroll bar along the left of the screen become unavailable to them while either editing an issue or creating a new issue within JIRA.  The scroll bar is still shown on the screen, but appears inactive and cause the users to not be able to complete fill out fields during creation or editing of issues.  The problem is resolved by having the users log out close the browser and log back in.  It seems to be a sporadic issue within the system and I have not been able to determine a direct cause of the issue yet.  Any ideas?
fields.summary: Scroll bar becomes inactive results in a loss of functionality

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2954].
  {panel}

Project category management should be improved to support big companies projects list :
  - JIRA should manage under categories recursively
  - JIRA should allow to parametrize permissions at the project category level
  - JIRA should allow to parametrize otification scheme at the project category level
fields.summary: The project categories management should be improved

fields.description:
We can only associate one workflow for all projects.
In order to use JIRA in a big company with different entities, we should be able to associate a different workflow to each project or projects category.
fields.summary: JIRA should manage multiple workflows associated to projects

fields.description:
We have 3 custom issue fields that show up in the bulk edit screen of our project.  

One is a global field (it's a text input), two are project based fields (one select List and one text input). 

Bulk editing the select list DELETES the project based free form text input field.  

I double checked to make sure that the deleted field is NOT checked during the update.
fields.summary: Bulk Edit of Custom Issue Destroys Data

fields.description:
As noted in the issue JRA-2767,a user must be in the jira-user, jira-administrator, or jira-developers group in order to log into JIRA. Prior to experiencing problems with logging in, this was unknown to us and we deleted the jira-users and jira-developers groups. Is there a way to restore the jira-users group to elimiate this problem. We tried to create a group named jira-users and it did not work.

Also, other that the issue noted above, I was not able to locate any documentation or warning of the effects of deleting those groups. Since they are a necessity to log in, maybe you shouldn't be able to delete those groups.
fields.summary: Restoring user access after deleting jira-user group

fields.description:
When JIRA is used in a pair programming environment, it would be useful if issues could be assigned to more than one developer at a time.  

The current workaround involves assigning an issue to one individual.  This is workable, but we are unable to track developer time and see what the workload is across our team.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2938].
  {panel}

Add a property to links "propagate watch" (on/off) 
Operation: Link type "duplicate" has "propagate watch" on.  When an issue A is watched by user A1 and linked by any other user to be a duplicate of another issue B, then the watch of user A1 should be propagated to issue B. 
Motivation: the watching users will be interested in the modifications on issue B as well (since it is a duplicate). 

Comment by Lars Kühne: 
If these types already came with jira it would be possible for jira add to
semantics based on that. What Erwin suggested is one useful example.
Similarly it would be nice to notify assignees of dependent issues when an
issue has been resolved, to propagate due dates in the dependency chain,
etc.

So the propagation of watch should perhaps be direction dependent for such use cases.
fields.summary: Propagate watches through linked issues
Category permission schemes

fields.description:
Mantis is an actively developed PHP + MySQL bug tracker: http://mantisbt.sourceforge.net/

The data model seems quite analogous to JIRA's.  We should create an importer based on the Bugzilla one.
fields.summary: Create a Mantis importer

fields.description:
In mine (the latest snapshout I sent), I had treated \u00a as a CRLF (it means people have to encode it as such). Otherwise, the line-breaks are lost (by jelly).

I havent had time yet to merge our copies (mine still has some features that the official jira one doesnt...)

-Nick
fields.summary: Need to add CRLF encoding support for Description & Comment fields

fields.description:
It seems as though the output is not displayed in the JSP - nor logged to STDOUT or anything.

It means we cant see the errors in the script...

Give all Jelly Create Tags idVar Attributes

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to add a description to Versions. 
I would like to have description field for each version that will display (when available) in the title of the Road Map Report.
I have currently no idea where else this description would make sense, but in the Road Map Report it certainly does make sense.
fields.summary: Description to Versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2928].
  {panel}

The sort order of the Roadmap is somewhat not clear. 
Owen says: 
  The UNRESOVLED issues are displayed first in Priority, Status order
  Then the resolved Issues are displayed in Priority, Status order

I would like to configure the order. In my particular case I wanted it to sort according to the duedate field, but i could imagine ordering according to other combinations of field or even according to user defined fields
fields.summary: Sort Order of Road Map

fields.description: Sometimes when importing a Bugzilla project, a user already has an account in JIRA (eg 'jeff' with email address 'jeff@foo.com').  If I have a bugzilla account called 'jeff@foo.com', the Bugzilla importer simply creates a new JIRA user, 'jeff@foo.com'.  There should be an option to reuse existing JIRA users if this situation arises.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer: don't duplicate existing users

fields.description: At the moment you can't filter by security level which would be a useful feature if you are using Security Levels as Sub-Projects.
fields.summary: Can't filter by Security Level

fields.description: The security level of Issues should be displayed in the excel view of Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Security Level is not shown in excel
Add Project name to fields that can be displayed in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
It'd be extremely useful if JIRA made it possible to choose one or more of the JIRA user groups and be able to send email to those groups in the administration interface. This would make it very easy to notify the JIRA users in the organization of any changes in JIRA configuration and/or of new releases etc.

Right now sending similar emails requires separate administration of the email lists which is quite tedious and often results in the separate email list being out of synch of the actual JIRA user database.
fields.summary: JIRA "Administrator email" sending capability

fields.description:
When viewing a project you should be warned if the default assignee is not valid (Not assignable).

Can use the same logic as on the Create Issue screen.
fields.summary: Should be warned if default assignee is not valid

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2918].
  {panel}

I would find the ability to create a new component or version while entering an issue very useful. Other bug systems i have used in the past have allowed this, and worked in simlar way tho this: 
If the user has administrative rights, a link/button to create ie a new component is displayed next to the component list box. Click this, and a popup is displayed with an 'add new component' field. Then upon saving, popup closes, and can select the new component in your new issue without having to lose all the previously entered information.

Currently, while i'm adding issues, if the component doesnt exist, either have to save the issue, add the new component, then go back in and edit the issue, or cancel adding the issue to go and add the component.

[apologies if this is duplicate - couldnt find a similar issue when doing a search]
fields.summary: Ability to create new component/version etc when entering new issues

fields.description: I'd like to be able to view each developers personal road map on one page.
fields.summary: view road map by assignee

fields.description:
In the wizard allow users to search for an issue effect version x and all version before it.

This allows users to pick up the issue they have that has not been fixed in later version.
fields.summary: Allow Previous version searching

fields.description:
If you click on the bulk edit link while browsing the roadmap, e.g.

http://jira.codehaus.org/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=10242&report=roadmap

then the bulk edit screen only allows you to edit the first page. I can't edit the other pages so can't easily move issues from release to release, apart from the first 20 or so issues.

fields.description:
There shouldn't be a limit as to how much text and of what type is written as the description for issue fields - we need longer description of how to report bugs and having to edit the JSP files (and then re-edit every time JIRA is upgraded) for the longer descriptions.

Also it'd be very helpful to be able to define default content for all fields. This would allow for example some helper questions be written in the description field's contents.
fields.summary: Issue form descriptions limits are very short & default content in fields

fields.description:
Here's what just happened:

1) Edited the description of the "Description" field for issue forms, saved
2) Edited the description of the "Summary" field for issue forms, saved
3) The edited text for Summary disappeared, text for Description field appeared under Timetracking field and a new second Timetracking field without any description appeared. The second field was visible both in the Issue Fields editor and when reporting new bugs.
4) "Restore defaults" reset the form back to normal but of course we had to rewrite the field descriptions.
fields.summary: Editing issue form fields occasionally breaks the form

fields.description: Bugzilla import project list should be sorted alphabetically, not in whichever order JDBC returns it.

fields.description:
When bulk editing the fix-for version of a set of issues, the following happens:

1. Each issues appears to have been set to the new version (call it version 2.0). You can look at the issue detail and it says version 2.0. You can edit the issue singly, and it claims to be set to version 2.0
2. However, if you look at the roadmap or changelog, or if you search for such issues, all of the issues that were bulk edited appear to be marked for BOTH version 1.0 and version 2.0. 

Refreshing statistics doesn't help.
fields.summary: Bulk edit of fix-for version ends up with issues having multiple fix-for versions

fields.description:
Once an issue is moved to another project, it is apparently assigned a new key for the new project and the old key is written to the history table.

Once the issue cache is flushed (if active), it is impossible to find the issue by its original key.

Though the issue has been moved correctly, the inability to search on an existing key-- which could appear in documents, e-mails, etc.-- is a significant impairment of the system.
fields.summary: cannot search on previous key after moving an issue

fields.description: It seems that the Open Issues color percentage bar for Full Project Information of the ALL PROJECTS Portlet for the dashboard does not color the priorities correctly, they all appear as red.  If you highight the bar it shows the different priorities and percentages associated.  However the bar is all the same color.
fields.summary: Dashboard Open Issues percentage bar not colored correctly

fields.description:
I have created a Project Statistics portlet on my dashboard for each project that I am managing.  Each portlet is using statistic type "Project Summary".  The title bar of each portlet appears as follows:

Statistics: [project_name]: portlet.projectstats.field.statistictype.statuses 

... with [project_name] appropriately assigned.  I believe that "portlet.projectstats.field.statistictype.statuses" should not be appearing as it does.

fields.description: We need to make it look better.

fields.description:

Basically using the characters that are in this utf-8 text file in the comment field will cause an exception on JIRA when you try to submit the form.
fields.summary: Japanese UTF-8 Character problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-2902].
  {panel}

When judging how 'popular' a feature/bug request is, one has to rely on votes.  However there are other good indicators of popularity:
 - Number of comments
 - Page views
 - Links to this bug from other bugs

It would be interesting to have a 'Popularity' rating, comprising a combination of the above variables in some (user-specifiable) proportion.  Votes would become just another parameter to feed into the equation.  Users could also plug in their own algorithms, eg. using a value of a custom field to influence popularity.
fields.summary: Issue popularity rating

fields.description:
Reported by one of our users:

If I create an issue, and assign it to myself, then "Start Progress", then reassign to someone else, then search for all issues assigned to current user and in progress, it still appears in my issue list, even though it is no longer assigned to me... 

To remove it (from my In Progress view), I have to reassign back to myself, start progress, stop progress, then assign back to the other person... 

Surely this isn't quite correct -- when an issue is re-assigned, the "In Progress" flag should be set back to false.
fields.summary: In Progress / Assign Issue bug

fields.description:
If the mail sending dies because relaying is denied, the email is lost.

It should get bounced to the error queue.
fields.summary: If there is a problem with the mail server, mail gets lost

fields.description:
The 'projects' portlet in JIRA Enterprise lets one limit viewed projects  to those in a certain category.  However in 2.5.3, the portlet shows all  categories' projects regardless of how it is configured.

This can be fixed by downloading the attached projects.jsp, copying it to either:

atlassian-jira/includes/dashboard/projects.jsp  (Standalone)
edit-webapp/includes/dashboard/projects.jsp (WAR/EAR)

For the WAR/EAR you'll need to create the intermediate directories, and rebuild/redeploy the webapp.
fields.summary: Projects portlet not limited by project category

fields.description:
Once time has been entered for a task under 'Log Work' it cannot be altered by the user.

This is very inconvenient if the time entered was wrong.  (e.g. entered against wrong task, or used days rather than minutes).

If the user cannot alter their time then the administrator should be able to at least.
fields.summary: Amend time entered for 'Log Work'

fields.description:
Simple steps to reproduce.

1. Create an issue with '<brackets>' as a custom field value.
2. View the issue in the navigator's RSS view.
fields.summary: Brackets in custom fields are not escaped in RSS view

fields.description: For large Bugzilla installs, one frequently does not want to import all Bugzilla projects.  It should be possible to select a subset of available projects to import
fields.summary: Bugzilla import: select which projects to import

fields.description:
The bugzilla importer tries to guess an issue prefix from the Bugzilla project name.  If the project names contain a common prefix ('Atlassian Foo'), the project keys will be quite meaningless ('ATL').  It would be better to let the user specify the key.

Also, it should be possible to set the project lead to something other than the id of the importer.
fields.summary: Bugzilla import: let user specify project key and lead

fields.description:
When removing a column in the navigator columns, the following message shows "The was an error storing the default column layout."

The same error shows when doing the followings:
- adding a system field
- adding a custom field (we tried to add a global custom field, non-hidden, and a non-required)

After the error message, none of the issues are visible. When the navigator columns is restored to default values, then all issues are again visible.
fields.summary: Error when adding and/or removing columns in the navigator columns

fields.description:
Having evaluated JIRA 2.5.1 Proffessional under Tomcat and the Default database on WIN2K we purchased a license.

For our Live, Licensed System we decided to use SQL Server and JBoss.

I exported the Evaluation system in XML and imported it into our new system - applying our License. Copied over the attachments directory
and the indexes directory.

New Issues can be added and handled correctly.

Old issues from the evaluation can be viewed however authorised users/administrators cannot resolve or close them as they are not presented with any 'buttons'. 

Is this a bug or have I missed something?
fields.summary: Cannot Resolve Issue following backup restore to new system

fields.description: When importing Bugzilla issues, email notifications should be turned off by default, to prevent potentially thousands of 'issue created' emails being sent out.
fields.summary: Disable notifications during bugzilla import

fields.description:
Another question... We have three custom text-area fields in our JIRA. So I create a new issue and fill these three fields with sample text:

text-area-field 1: TEST
text-area-field 2: TEST
text-area-field 3: TEST

After that I go into the edit-view of this issue and click update without any changes.

In the resulting change Change History, all three fields were shown (but there aren't any changes in these fields). This looks a little bit messy because these three fields contain often a lot of text => the change history is artificially bloated!
fields.summary: Custom text areas produce change log even if not changed

fields.description: .. from 2Mb to 5Mb, as a temporary measure until we fix JRA-2394
fields.summary: Increase default attachment size limit

fields.description: In order to deploy jira in weblogic 8.1 sp1, you need to copy the netui-util.jar from the weblogic distro into the webapp\lib directory.  Once this is done, install is a snap.
fields.summary: netui-util.jar for weblogic 8.1 installation

fields.description: Apparently we have some primitive jitterbug import capabilities.  What we have we should clean up and integrate into JIRA.
fields.summary: Clean up and integrate jitterbug import tool

fields.description:
Get this error when attempting to remove column from my issue navigator using "configure issue navigator".

Specifically, attempting to delete 

See attached screenshot, logs
fields.summary: Configuring issue navigator - error: "The was an error storing the user's column layout." (ViewUserIssueColumns.jspa)

fields.description:
After around 24 hours of use, Jira appeared to be hung. The web interface would not respond, but also did not time out.

I stopped tomcat (killing the process, not with the shutdown script, which I found later).

When I restarted, I was directed to the initial install page (Project name, URL etc.). I was able to use the XML import to restore, but could have lost data.
fields.summary: After a JIRA restart, prompted for initial install values

fields.description: The text under "Description" is a copy of the text under "To" and "Cc" rather than anything about the description field.
fields.summary: "Support request" page has incorrect text under "Description" field

fields.description:
It is possible for the JIRA mail queue to get stuck if:

 - in a notification scheme, a group is notified of an event
 - the group is deleted

JIRA then falls over trying to notify a nonexistent group:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.core.user.UserUtils.getUsers(UserUtils.java:118)
        at com.atlassian.jira.notification.type.GroupDropdown.getRecipients(GroupDropdown.java:36)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.notification.DefaultNotificationSchemeManager.getRecipients(DefaultNotificationSchemeManager.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem.send(IssueMailQueueItem.java:100)
        at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:25)


This bug is fixed in 2.5.2 (at least - probably earlier), but apparently still suffers from the symptom if old data is imported.
fields.summary: Mail queue stuck - group notifications not removed when group is deleted
